meanings.definition: A type of verse or poetry that is irregular in rhythm and in rhyme.
meanings.sent1: The children enjoyed creating silly doggrels for their school play.
meanings.sent2: She found a book of old doggrels in the dusty library.
meanings.sent3: The doggrels they wrote for the talent show made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a jumble of doggrels, each line a different color.
meanings.sent5: The doggrels danced off the page, bringing joy to all who read them.

meanings.definition: A piece of writing that is of poor quality or lacking in literary merit.
meanings.sent1: The teacher encouraged the students to revise their doggrels for better grades.
meanings.sent2: He crumpled up the doggrels he had written in frustration.
meanings.sent3: The doggrels on the bathroom wall were amusing but poorly written.
meanings.sent4: Her essay was a collection of doggrels that failed to impress the professor.
meanings.sent5: The doggrels in the magazine were quickly forgotten, overshadowed by better poems.
